history.content:
Workload-wise I personally think 61C ~ 126 < 170.  Note that the workload types are very different though, 61C involves a lot of coding while 126 involves a thinking in respect to mathematical perspectives, while 170 focusses on algorithmic points of view.

Since you said you found your last semester's workload fine, then I think 53 + two of {61C, 126, 170} will be manageable for you. Based off your interests, I would suggest 126 + 170. 61C is a good class that bridges the hardware-software gap, but if you are more interested in math/stats stuff you should definitely take 126 and 170 first over 61C. 

----------

Took CS 61C last spring and currently taking CS 170. Workload-wise I think 61C >> 170, but Weaver said next semester's 61C will be similar to Garcia's style so idk.

Workload-wise I personally think 61C ~ 126 < 170.  Note that the workload types are very different though, 61C involves a lot of coding while 126 involves a thinking in respect to mathematical perspectives, while 170 focusses on algorithmic points of view.

Since you said you found your last semester's workload fine, then I think 53 + two of {61C, 126, 170} will be manageable for you. Based off your interests, I would suggest 126 + 170. 61C is a good class that bridges the hardware-software gap, but if you are more interested in math/stats stuff you should definitely take 126 and 170 first over 61C.

Hi everyone. I'm having a bit of trouble deciding my courses for next semester and I basically boiled my choices down to the options above. I know that 170's enrollment is still closed, but from everyone I've asked, there's a pretty high likelihood it will be offered. In that case, which of the combinations above do you feel is the relatively easiest one to take? 

With regards to my personal background to provide a bit of context, I'm currently taking 70 and enjoying both parts of it quite a lot (I just generally love math/stat related stuff) and my highest workload was spring last semester where I took 61B + EE 16B + Math 1B + R&C Writing + 2 unit IMT DeCal. I found the workload quite easy and did pretty well in those classes but I'm not sure how that translates to the workload for the upper div courses since these will be my introductory UDs. 

I'm currently enrolled in 126 and 53 so I will have to phase 2 61c and/or 170 regardless of the combination I end up picking so that might be worth keeping in mind I guess.

Another thing is that I would prefer to take 126 with Ramchandran next semester and 61c with Garcia in Fall but I'm willing to give up that preference if a different workload is considered easier. 

I'd really appreciate any help I can get with this. Thank you so much in advance!
history.subject: (61C + 126 + 53) vs (61C + 170 + 53) vs (126 + 170 + 53)
